content.text:
# Draft:Wheaton Warrenville South High School Football Team

----
The Wheaton Warrenville South High School football team is the seven time Illinois State Champions football team, belonging to Wheaton Warrenville South High School in Wheaton, Illinois. The Wheaton Warrenville South Football Team is considered a class 7A team under IHSA. As of the 2025 season the Wheaton Warrenville South Football Team is head coached by Sean Norris. The Wheaton Warrenville South Football Teams mascot is a Tiger, and their primary colors are Orange and Black. Currently the team plays home games at Red Grange Field at Wheaton Warrenville South High School located on 1993 Tiger Trail, Wheaton, Illinois. The tigers football team is currently in the DuKane High School Conference, along with 7 other teams (8 including South) including the high schools of: Geneva, Glenbard South, Batavia, Lake Park, Wheaton North, Saint Charles East, and Saint Charles North.
Wheaton North Rivalry
It is important to note that Wheaton Warrenville South currently has a long standing rivalry with Wheaton North High School, dating back to 1964. This rivalry stands not just in football, but also in many other sports. Once combined with Wheaton Warrenville South, Wheaton had one school named Wheaton Community High School. However in 1963, due to increased enrollment size, Wheaton Community High School split and formed Wheaton North and Wheaton South Warrenville South. Ever since, sporting teams have dueled it out on courts, pitches, but especially the football field. The rivalry today is known as the Cross Town Rivalry, and the entire town of Wheaton anticipates the game every year. The location to where the game is played rotates from Wheaton Warrenville Souths, Red Grange Field or to Wheaton Norths, Jim Rexilius Field. Wheaton Warrenville South currently is leading the football rivalry with a 15-7 record.
Red Grange Field
Red Grange Field is currently the home of the Wheaton Warrenville South High School Football Team. The field itself is named after NFL Hall of Famer Red Grange, whom attended Wheaton Warrenville South High School in the 1920s.It is important to note that Red Grange, never actually played there, the field was rather built later and named after him in respect. The field is encircled by a IHSA regulated track which was renovated in 2021. The field boasts a set of home bleachers with a press box on the side of the field facing the school. While the visitor bleachers are simple bleachers on the opposite side. The fields capacity is estimated to be approximately 1,650 with bleachers filled. However standing room around the field can accommodated up to 2,000. In the north end zone of the field, a scoreboard can be visibly viewed along with an American Flag (used for national anthem). The field is also used for lacrosse and soccer hosted by Wheaton Warrenville South High School.
Team Records
As of the 2024 season Wheaton Warrenville South High School currently holds an all-time overall record of 161-76. The tigers also currently hold a IHSA playoff record of 27-10.
